heading: cracked: ms' new music format
subheading: microsoft unveiled its long-awaited alternative to mp3, and a cracker quickly unleashed his program to get around ms' copyright restrictions. by jennifer sullivan and john gartner.
author: jennifer sullivan
text: talk about an inauspicious debut. just as microsoft released its much-anticipated digital music technology, a cracker found a way to circumvent its security restrictions -- and put a nasty moniker on it.read wired news' ongoing mp3 coverage
